markdown="[Back to Explore](https://www.alltrails.com/explore)\n\n# Angels Landing Trail\n\n4.9\n\n(37,513 reviews)\n\n·\n\nStrenuous\n\n·\n\n[Zion National Park](https://www.alltrails.com/parks/us/utah/zion-national-park)\n\nOverviewConditionsReviewsHit the trailNearby\n\nGet directionsHit the trail\n\n59,692 photos\n\n4.7miLength\n\n1,738ftElevation gain\n\nOut & back\n\nThe Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side. The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\n\nYou'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle stop. You'll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. The first few miles of this route along the West Rim Trail are on a paved path. Most of the path is sunny, but Refrigerator Canyon offers shade and often a cool breeze.\n\nEventually, you’ll come to Walter's Wiggles, a set of 21 switchbacks that take their name from Walter Ruesch, Zion National Park’s first superintendent. The section of the route follows a steep and narrow ridge from Scout Lookout to Angels Landing itself, a fantastic observation point 1500 feet above Zion Canyon. Anchored support chains are attached along some sections of the sheer cliff to assist your way up and down the carved steps. You are rewarded with an excellent view of the main canyon at the top.\n\nHeads up! It is a good idea to avoid standing near the edge at all times and avoid hiking this trail when it is wet, storming, or high winds are present. The route exposes hikers to steep drop-offs along cliff edges. You'll want to budget extra time for this route due to its technical sections. Although this is a popular hike all year round, the best time to hike this route is during the spring and fall. Summer afternoons can be dangerously hot, and winter weather conditions can cause the trail to be icy. The parking lot here fills up quickly so be sure to arrive early.\n\nGet directionsCustomize route\n\n3 alerts\n\nTop sights\n\n[Angels Landing\\\\\n\\\\\nPeak](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/angels-landing) [Zion Canyon\\\\\n\\\\\nValley](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/springdale/zion-canyon) [Scout Lookout\\\\\n\\\\\nViewpoint](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/springdale/scout-lookout) Show more\n\nPreview![Plus badge image](https://d27scpai1jcyi9.cloudfront.net/trail-app-router/bccf086224ae1c4a92c5d0e36c3aca7c821e6e2d/_next/static/media/plus-full-light-text.ef713369.svg)\n\n© Mapbox© Maxar© OpenStreetMap\n\nPlay\n\nTop sights\n\n[Angels Landing\\\\\n\\\\\nPeak](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/angels-landing) [Zion Canyon\\\\\n\\\\\nValley](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/springdale/zion-canyon) [Scout Lookout\\\\\n\\\\\nViewpoint](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/springdale/scout-lookout) Show more\n\n## Plan your visit\n\nFee required\n\nDogs not allowed\n\nPartially paved\n\nScramble\n\nRocky\n\nRivers\n\nShow more\n\nTrailgoers are saying\n\n4.9\n\nHighlights include spectacular views, a thrilling chain section, and varied scenery along the route. Challenges are steep climbs and crowded trails later in the day. Go early and carry water.\n\nThis summary is AI-generated from trail reviews and won’t always be perfect.\n\nWas it helpful?\n\nYes\n\nNo\n\nShow all reviews\n\nWeather\n\n## Reviews\n\n4.9\n\n37,644 reviews42,167 activities\n\n| 5 |  |  |\n| 4 |  |  |\n| 3 |  |  |\n| 2 |  |  |\n| 1 |  |  |\n\nReview trail\n\nMark as completed·\n\nSuggest edit\n\nSearch reviews\n\nBegin typing to search, use the up and down arrow keys to navigate, press enter to select\n\nAllTrails sort\n\n[Donovan Swann](https://www.alltrails.com/members/donovan-swann-1)\n\nDec 20, 2025·Hiking\n\nGreat views\n\nNot a trail for the faint of heart, most of the trail is doable for the average hiker besides the permitted upper section. If you want to miss the long lines of mediocre hikers going up the permitted route I would suggest leaving at 6:45 or 10 minutes before sunrise. (DO NOT ATTEMPT WITHOUT PERMIT) There was a couple that tried to beat the ranger by going up earlier without a permit and luckily ranger reggie stopped them on the way down, police were waiting by the time they got down the main hike with a 5000 dollar fine for each of them.\n\nDifficulty:Hard\n\n![Photo 1 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 2 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 3 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 4 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 5 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 6 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 7 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 8 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 9 of 9](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n[Show activity](https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/afternoon-hike-at-angels-landing-trail-e98619f)\n\n[David Sandrof](https://www.alltrails.com/members/david-sandrof)\n\nDec 18, 2025·Hiking\n\nNot crowdedBathrooms availableGreat conditionsGreat views\n\nGreat views all around for pretty much the entire way up. Did the route in mid December starting at 9:30 but clear sky and nice temperature even though it was about 40°. It took three attempts for myself and two attempts for my friend before we finally got the permit to Angels Landing. The section with the chains was very exciting with magnificent views all around. Personally, I was not intimidated by that section and I could almost have done it without the chains but a different story coming down. You needed them in several sections or else you would have had to be a whole lot more careful. Also continued on to the West Rim Trail and climbed about 400 feet before turning back.\n\nDifficulty:Hard\n\n![Photo 1 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 2 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 3 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 4 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 5 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 6 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 7 of 7](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n[Show activity](https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/afternoon-hike-at-angels-landing-trail-96b4b27)\n\n[Melissa Leyba](https://www.alltrails.com/members/melissa-leyba-2)\n\nDec 14, 2025\n\nNot crowdedBathrooms availableGreat conditionsGreat views\n\nWe went early Saturday morning on December 14. When we entered Zion at around 7:45am, we didn’t have to pay. When we reached the parking lot, the rangers helped us find where to park (there’s a small parking lot and a dirt parking lot available). It was really cold and windy at points throughout the hike but once we got to the top, it was sunny and a light breeze. I highly recommend wearing gloves as well as something to head and face warm! The wind combined with cold weather can be brutal. Walking down, it started to warm up and the crowds of people picked up considerably. It was nice getting there early, as there weren’t people but i could see how going later could mean larger crowds.\n\n[Joe Monteiro](https://www.alltrails.com/members/joe-monteiro-3)\n\nYesterday·Hiking\n\nGreat conditionsGreat views\n\nThe trail is well maintained up to Scout Lookout. Rangers were stationed there to check permits when we arrived at 1pm. The route to Angels landing may need some light scrambling in certain sections but the fixed chains provide solid support, making the exposed portions feel manageable and generally safe for confident hikers. Round trip took approximately 2h20 total, including a break at the top.\n\nParking:Permit required, Paid\n\n![Photo 1 of 2](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 2 of 2](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n[Show activity](https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/afternoon-hike-at-angels-landing-trail-16c5da8)\n\n[Othman Al alawi](https://www.alltrails.com/members/othman-al-alawi-1)\n\nYesterday·Hiking\n\nBathrooms availableGreat conditionsGreat views\n\nThe most beautiful hike I have ever done\n\nDifficulty:Hard\n\n![Photo 1 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 2 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 3 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 4 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 5 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 6 of 6](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n[Show activity](https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/afternoon-hike-at-angels-landing-trail-c6301ab)\n\n[Shataki Guha](https://www.alltrails.com/members/shataki-guha)\n\nYesterday·Hiking\n\nGreat conditionsGreat views\n\nMost beautiful hike I have ever done. Get to the parking lot early it will fill up and it’s better to have th trail by yourself. Without stopping for lunch etc the hike only took about an hour and a half. Chains are not as bad as they look in the videos I barely even used them. Super fun and different hike definitely a must do if you’re in Zion! Just hold the rails\n\nWe started this hike taking the 2nd shuttle in the morning. I’d recommend taking the first shuttle if you want a solo experience. It was fairly easy till scouts lookout. Definitely great view of the canyons even if you don’t have the permit.\n\nWe had the day before permit from the lottery. Rangers checked it and warned us about the rocks being slick as it was drizzling a bit. The first 10 mins there’s a part without rails that’s a bit tricky (not scary) that you need to scramble but the rest of it is pretty manageable. There are great views all the way up. Less crowded in December than it would be in summers I’d guess.\n\nOn the way down you’ll feel confident and you won’t feel a thing although I’d recommend crouching and scrambling to feel comfortable. It started raining by the time we were back to the lookout and saw few people turning back.\n\nI have my brave wife to thank for the hike. She led the way.\n\nA must do in Zion.\n\nDifficulty:Strenuous\n\n![Photo 1 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 2 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 3 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 4 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 5 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 6 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 7 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 8 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 9 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n![Photo 10 of 10](https://www.alltrails.com/mugen/image/trail-app-router?url=https%3A%2F%2Fimages.alltrails.com%&w=256&q=75)\n\n[Show activity](https://www.alltrails.com/explore/recording/afternoon-hike-at-angels-landing-trail-b7e89a5)\n\n## Hit the trail\n\n## Frequently asked questions\n\n### What’s helpful to know about this trail?\n\nProceed cautiously on this 4.7-mile out-and-back trail near Springdale, Utah. Generally considered a highly challenging route, it should only be attempted by experienced adventurers. This is a very popular area for hiking, so you'll likely encounter other people while exploring. The best times to visit this trail are March through November. You'll need to leave pups at home — dogs aren't allowed on this trail.\n\n### What are some of the facilities available for Angels Landing Trail?\n\nIn 1997 the shuttle system was established to eliminate traffic and parking problems & protect vegetation. It is recommended to take the shuttle to this popular trailhead.\n\n### What is the expected weather this week for Angels Landing Trail?\n\nExpected weather for Angels Landing Trail for the next 5 days is:\n\n- Fri, December 26 - 50 degrees/showers\n- Sat, December 27 - 46 degrees/rain/snow\n- Sun, December 28 - 40 degrees/clear\n- Mon, December 29 - 47 degrees/clear\n- Tue, December 30 - 52 degrees/clear\n\n### Where is Angels Landing Trail located?\n\nAngels Landing Trail is a trail located in [Zion National Park](https://www.alltrails.com/parks/us/utah/zion-national-park).\n\n### Are dogs allowed on Angels Landing Trail?\n\nNo, dogs are not allowed on Angels Landing Trail.\n\n### When is the best time of year to hike Angels Landing Trail?\n\nMarch to November is the most popular time of year to visit Angels Landing Trail.\n\nShow more\n\n## Top trails nearby\n\n[Scout Lookout via West Rim Trail](https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/scout-lookout-trail)\n\n[![Photo 1 of 1 of the Patriarchs Viewpoint Trail\n\n[Zion National Park](https://www.alltrails.com/parks/us/utah/zion-national-park)\n\n4.4·Moderate·0.1 mi·Est.0.5–1 hr\n\n[Angels Landing, West Rim, Telephone [Pullout](https://www.alltrails.com/poi/us/utah/springdale/pullout)\n\nDownloadOpen map" html=None raw_html=None json=None summary=None metadata=DocumentMetadata(title='Angels Landing Trail, Utah - 37,513 Reviews, Map | AllTrails', description="• Fee Information: Zion National Park charges a fee to enter. For more information, please see https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/fees.htm\n• Access Information: Zion National Park requires a permit to hike the Angels Landing trail. For more information, please visit: https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/angels-landing-hiking-permits.htm\n• Access Information: The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is closed to private vehicles during the shuttle season. For more information, visit www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-shuttle-system.htm\n\nThe Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side.  The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\n\nYou'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle stop. You'll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. The first few miles of this route along the West Rim Trail are on a paved path. Most of the path is sunny, but Refrigerator Canyon offers shade and often a cool breeze.\n\nEventually, you’ll come to Walter's Wiggles, a set of 21 switchbacks that take their name from Walter Ruesch, Zion National Park’s first superintendent. The section of the route follows a steep and narrow ridge from Scout Lookout to Angels Landing itself, a fantastic observation point 1500 feet above Zion Canyon. Anchored support chains are attached along some sections of the sheer cliff to assist your way up and down the carved steps. You are rewarded with an excellent view of the main canyon at the top.\n\nHeads up! It is a good idea to avoid standing near the edge at all times and avoid hiking this trail when it is wet, storming, or high winds are present. The route exposes hikers to steep drop-offs along cliff edges. You'll want to budget extra time for this route due to its technical sections. Although this is a popular hike all year round, the best time to hike this route is during the spring and fall. Summer afternoons can be dangerously hot, and winter weather conditions can cause the trail to be icy. The parking lot here fills up quickly so be sure to arrive early.", url='https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail', language='en', keywords=None, robots='follow', og_title='Angels Landing Trail', og_description="• Fee Information: Zion National Park charges a fee to enter. For more information, please see https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/fees.htm\n• Access Information: Zion National Park requires a permit to hike the Angels Landing trail. For more information, please visit: https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/angels-landing-hiking-permits.htm\n• Access Information: The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is closed to private vehicles during the shuttle season. For more information, visit www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-shuttle-system.htm\n\nThe Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side.  The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\n\nYou'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle stop. You'll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. The first few miles of this route along the West Rim Trail are on a paved path. Most of the path is sunny, but Refrigerator Canyon offers shade and often a cool breeze.\n\nEventually, you’ll come to Walter's Wiggles, a set of 21 switchbacks that take their name from Walter Ruesch, Zion National Park’s first superintendent. The section of the route follows a steep and narrow ridge from Scout Lookout to Angels Landing itself, a fantastic observation point 1500 feet above Zion Canyon. Anchored support chains are attached along some sections of the sheer cliff to assist your way up and down the carved steps. You are rewarded with an excellent view of the main canyon at the top.\n\nHeads up! It is a good idea to avoid standing near the edge at all times and avoid hiking this trail when it is wet, storming, or high winds are present. The route exposes hikers to steep drop-offs along cliff edges. You'll want to budget extra time for this route due to its technical sections. Although this is a popular hike all year round, the best time to hike this route is during the spring and fall. Summer afternoons can be dangerously hot, and winter weather conditions can cause the trail to be icy. The parking lot here fills up quickly so be sure to arrive early.", og_url='https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail', og_image='https://www.alltrails.com/api/alltrails/v3/maps/346265104/share_image?image_type=default&photo_id=42787626&shape=rectangle&units=i', og_audio=None, og_determiner=None, og_locale=None, og_locale_alternate=None, og_site_name='AllTrails.com', og_video=None, favicon='https://www.alltrails.com/app-icon-16.png', dc_terms_created=None, dc_date_created=None, dc_date=None, dc_terms_type=None, dc_type=None, dc_terms_audience=None, dc_terms_subject=None, dc_subject=None, dc_description=None, dc_terms_keywords=None, modified_time=None, published_time=None, article_tag=None, article_section=None, source_url='https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail', status_code=200, scrape_id='019b5bfe-c4ce-72b4-854c-de6c8a70ce0d', num_pages=None, content_type='text/html; charset=utf-8', proxy_used='stealth', timezone='America/New_York', cache_state=None, cached_at=None, credits_used=5, concurrency_limited=False, concurrency_queue_duration_ms=None, error=None, og:image:width='640', og:image:height='640', twitter:site='@AllTrails', twitter:description="• Fee Information: Zion National Park charges a fee to enter. For more information, please see https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/fees.htm\n• Access Information: Zion National Park requires a permit to hike the Angels Landing trail. For more information, please visit: https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/angels-landing-hiking-permits.htm\n• Access Information: The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is closed to private vehicles during the shuttle season. For more information, visit www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-shuttle-system.htm\n\nThe Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side.  The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\n\nYou'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle stop. You'll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. The first few miles of this route along the West Rim Trail are on a paved path. Most of the path is sunny, but Refrigerator Canyon offers shade and often a cool breeze.\n\nEventually, you’ll come to Walter's Wiggles, a set of 21 switchbacks that take their name from Walter Ruesch, Zion National Park’s first superintendent. The section of the route follows a steep and narrow ridge from Scout Lookout to Angels Landing itself, a fantastic observation point 1500 feet above Zion Canyon. Anchored support chains are attached along some sections of the sheer cliff to assist your way up and down the carved steps. You are rewarded with an excellent view of the main canyon at the top.\n\nHeads up! It is a good idea to avoid standing near the edge at all times and avoid hiking this trail when it is wet, storming, or high winds are present. The route exposes hikers to steep drop-offs along cliff edges. You'll want to budget extra time for this route due to its technical sections. Although this is a popular hike all year round, the best time to hike this route is during the spring and fall. Summer afternoons can be dangerously hot, and winter weather conditions can cause the trail to be icy. The parking lot here fills up quickly so be sure to arrive early.", twitter:image:alt='AllTrails', twitter:title='Angels Landing Trail, Utah - 37,513 Reviews, Map | AllTrails', og:title='Angels Landing Trail', og:image='https://www.alltrails.com/api/alltrails/v3/maps/346265104/share_image?image_type=default&photo_id=42787626&shape=rectangle&units=i', og:image:alt='AllTrails', copyright='© 2010-2025 AllTrails, LLC', og:type='website', theme-color='#2b381f', facebook-domain-verification='6sh9vc7x1667ruajj38c5eumwnj4rb', og:description="• Fee Information: Zion National Park charges a fee to enter. For more information, please see https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/fees.htm\n• Access Information: Zion National Park requires a permit to hike the Angels Landing trail. For more information, please visit: https://www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/angels-landing-hiking-permits.htm\n• Access Information: The Zion Canyon Scenic Drive is closed to private vehicles during the shuttle season. For more information, visit www.nps.gov/zion/planyourvisit/zion-canyon-shuttle-system.htm\n\nThe Angels Landing Trail is a technical route in Zion National Park with steep drop-offs, scrambles, and very narrow sections. Though it is protected by chains in many sections, the final push to the landing is considered Class 3 terrain due to the exposure, short steep scrambles, and steep drop-offs on either side.  The incredible views of Zion Canyon make this hike the most popular in Zion.\n\nYou'll start by parking at The Grotto Trailhead or taking the West Rim Shuttle to The Grotto shuttle stop. You'll cross a bridge over the Virgin River onto the West Rim Trail. The first few miles of this route along the West Rim Trail are on a paved path. Most of the path is sunny, but Refrigerator Canyon offers shade and often a cool breeze.\n\nEventually, you’ll come to Walter's Wiggles, a set of 21 switchbacks that take their name from Walter Ruesch, Zion National Park’s first superintendent. The section of the route follows a steep and narrow ridge from Scout Lookout to Angels Landing itself, a fantastic observation point 1500 feet above Zion Canyon. Anchored support chains are attached along some sections of the sheer cliff to assist your way up and down the carved steps. You are rewarded with an excellent view of the main canyon at the top.\n\nHeads up! It is a good idea to avoid standing near the edge at all times and avoid hiking this trail when it is wet, storming, or high winds are present. The route exposes hikers to steep drop-offs along cliff edges. You'll want to budget extra time for this route due to its technical sections. Although this is a popular hike all year round, the best time to hike this route is during the spring and fall. Summer afternoons can be dangerously hot, and winter weather conditions can cause the trail to be icy. The parking lot here fills up quickly so be sure to arrive early.", viewport=['width=device-width, initial-scale=1', 'width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0 viewport-fit=cover'], og:url='https://www.alltrails.com/trail/us/utah/angels-landing-trail', revisit-after='3 days', twitter:card='summary_large_image', place:location:latitude='37.2591', og:site_name='AllTrails.com', place:location:longitude='-112.95122', fb:app_id='18128749820', og:image:secure_url='https://www.alltrails.com/api/alltrails/v3/maps/346265104/share_image?image_type=default&photo_id=42787626&shape=rectangle&units=i', twitter:image='https://www.alltrails.com/api/alltrails/v3/maps/346265104/share_image?image_type=default&photo_id=42787626&shape=rectangle&units=i', indexId='af5fefe1-8f8b-46e8-b5db-1a62ef6d19f2') links=None images=None screenshot=None actions=None warning=None change_tracking=None branding=None
